itemDescription: Scottish minister and missionary in India

wikipedia_page.main: George Carstairs (1880–1948) was a Church of Scotland minister and missionary in India. In later life he was editor of Life and Work.

response: Carstairs was born on 18 June 1916 in Mussoorie, India, then part of the British Raj. He was the son of George Carstairs (died 1948), a Church of Scotland missionary, and his wife Elizabeth Huntley Young. He spent his childhood living in India and became fluent in both English and Hindi. At the age of ten, he and his family moved to Edinburgh, Scotland. He was educated at George Watson's College, then an all-boys independent school in Edinburgh.
* The Reverend George Carstairs, , Missionary, Church of Scotland, Ajmer-Merwara, Rajputana.
George Carstairs was an Australian rugby league player.
George Carstairs may also refer to:
* George Carstairs (Church of Scotland) (1880–1948), Scottish missionary in India
